cadPolicyMib.name: cadPolicyMib

revisions.description: Use new default protocol type
Remove cadAclMemorySize and cadAclMemoryRemaining

Change index of cadPolicyPfxListEntry - Add cadPolicyPfxListAfi and cadPolicyPfxListSafi as part of the index. Change syntax of cadPolicyPfxListIpAddress from IpAddress to InetAddress to support both ipv4 and ipv6.

Added the following new objects cadRouteMapSetIpDscp, cadRouteMapIpDscp, cadRouteMapSetRecursiveNextHop, and cadRouteMapRecursiveNextHop. Change the range of the following objects from up to 2048 to 64 cadRouteMapId, cadRouteMapTagId, cadLocalPolicyRouteMap, and cadRouteMapClearStats
Changed range for cadDistListOutAccessListNum from 1-999 to 0-999
Added cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv6AclName and cadDistListOutAccessListName
changed the syntax of cadRouteMapClearStats from TruthValue to Integer32
changed the range of cadRouteMapTagId and cadRouteMapSeqNum.
Add support for policy based routing.
Support IPv6 VR Index and IPv6 access numbers in CadDistListOut table.

change syntax of cadAclSrcIp, cadAclSrcIpMask, cadAclDstIp, cadAclDstIpMask to InetAddressIpv4orv6. add cadAlvIpAddrType. rename cadPolicyAccessGroupAclNum to cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv4ActNum add cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv6AclNum change syntax of cadAclOrderAclIndex from (1..199) to (1..399)
Remove support for multiple SCM access ACLs
Add support for ACL memory sizes.
ACL support for RCM-based CMTS - remove the range of (1300..2699) in aclNumber.
ACL support for RCM-based CMTS.
Allow setting of cadAclType to remark.
Add support for named ACLs and resequencing of ACLs.
Allow arbitrary ACL indexes.
Remove redundant access list configuration.
Add set-fabric-priority-transmit for Multicast QoS for Arris Channel Bonding.
Merge with 4.6.
Add policy tables from old Netplane MIB.
Swap the key order of src and dest protocol in cadDistListOutTable.
Add support for network side data plane ACLs.
Create table for output distribution lists.
Add support for CAR rate limiting feature.
Create table for input distribution lists.
Create table for SCM access control policy.

cadPolicyMib.contactinfo: Arris Technical Support Postal: ARRIS E-Mail: support@arrisi.com
cadPolicyMib.description: Arris Cadant C4 CMTS policy parameters and constants

CadPolicyAction.name: CadPolicyAction
CadPolicyAction.description: Action to be taken for Policy Policy Permit(1) Policy Deny (2)

CadPolicyProtocol.name: CadPolicyProtocol
CadPolicyProtocol.description: A value that represents a type of the protocol.

cadScmAccessTable.name: cadScmAccessTable
cadScmAccessTable.description: A table contains SCM access control list information. Each physical interface is associated with the access list number defined as hjpolAccListNumber in hjpolAccListTable of NETPLANE-POLICY-MIB. With this information, C4 can permit/deny access usnig access list filtering before the packet reach SCM from the specified physical interface.

cadScmAccessEntry.name: cadScmAccessEntry
cadScmAccessEntry.description: A conceptual row containing information about SCM access list for each physical interface.

cadScmAccIfIndex.name: cadScmAccIfIndex
cadScmAccIfIndex.description: The value of this object identifies a physical layer2 interface, such as a DOCSIS MAC or a Gigabit/TenGigabit NAM, on which SCM access control is applied

cadScmAccListNumber.name: cadScmAccListNumber
cadScmAccListNumber.description: The value of this object identifies entry(or entries) in the hjpolAccListTable. The identified entry(or entries) contains SCM access parameters to be used when filtering traffic from individual interface sent to SCM.

cadScmAccRowStatus.name: cadScmAccRowStatus
cadScmAccRowStatus.description: Control Object for row creation and deletion.

cadDistListInEntry.name: cadDistListInEntry
cadDistListInEntry.description: A row in Distribute List In table

cadDistListInProtocol.name: cadDistListInProtocol
cadDistListInProtocol.description: Protocol for which distribute list is applied.

cadDistListInProtocolProcess.name: cadDistListInProtocolProcess
cadDistListInProtocolProcess.description: VRF for which distribute list is applied.

cadDistListInIfIndex.name: cadDistListInIfIndex
cadDistListInIfIndex.description: Interface for which distribute list is applied. The value will be 1 if the distribute list is applied to all interfaces.

cadDistListInAccessListNum.name: cadDistListInAccessListNum
cadDistListInAccessListNum.description: The configured distribute in list refers to the access list specified.

cadDistListInAccessListName.name: cadDistListInAccessListName
cadDistListInAccessListName.description: Name of the access list referred by distribute in list.

cadDistListInStatus.name: cadDistListInStatus
cadDistListInStatus.description: The row status variable, used according to row installation and removal conventions. Once access list specified default row status is active.

cadPolicyRateLimitTable.name: cadPolicyRateLimitTable
cadPolicyRateLimitTable.description: A table of rate limiting policies applied to a physical interface.

cadPolicyRateLimitEntry.name: cadPolicyRateLimitEntry
cadPolicyRateLimitEntry.description: An ordered list of the rate limit polices

cadPolicyRateLimitIfIndex.name: cadPolicyRateLimitIfIndex
cadPolicyRateLimitIfIndex.description: The value of this object identifies a physical layer2 interface, such as a DOCSIS MAC or a Gigabit/TenGigabit NAM, on which the rate limit policy is applied

cadPolicyRateLimitDirection.name: cadPolicyRateLimitDirection
cadPolicyRateLimitDirection.description: Direction of traffic on interface to apply the rate limit policy

cadPolicyRateLimitIndex.name: cadPolicyRateLimitIndex
cadPolicyRateLimitIndex.description: Index of rate limit policy. Policies are applied in the order specified by this index value

cadPolicyRateLimitStatus.name: cadPolicyRateLimitStatus
cadPolicyRateLimitStatus.description: Create and delete table row entries.

cadPolicyRateLimitAclType.name: cadPolicyRateLimitAclType
cadPolicyRateLimitAclType.description: Type of ACL associated with rate limit policy

cadPolicyRateLimitAclNum.name: cadPolicyRateLimitAclNum
cadPolicyRateLimitAclNum.description: ACL number. If the ACL does not exist, then this is treated as if the ACL type is none, i.e. all IP traffic matches the policy.

cadPolicyRateLimitBps.name: cadPolicyRateLimitBps
cadPolicyRateLimitBps.description: Average rate, in bits per second (bps).

cadPolicyRateLimitBurstNormal.name: cadPolicyRateLimitBurstNormal
cadPolicyRateLimitBurstNormal.description: Normal burst size, in bytes. The minimum value is bps divided by 2000.

cadPolicyRateLimitBurstMax.name: cadPolicyRateLimitBurstMax
cadPolicyRateLimitBurstMax.description: Excess burst size, in bytes. Must be equal to or larger than cadPolicyRateLimitBurstNormal

cadPolicyRateLimitConformAction.name: cadPolicyRateLimitConformAction
cadPolicyRateLimitConformAction.description: Action to take on packets that conform to the specified rate limit.

cadPolicyRateLimitConformValue.name: cadPolicyRateLimitConformValue
cadPolicyRateLimitConformValue.description: Value to set if action is set-prec-transmit, set-dscp-transmit or set-priority-transmit. For set-priority-transmit,the valid value range is 0-7.

cadPolicyRateLimitExceedAction.name: cadPolicyRateLimitExceedAction
cadPolicyRateLimitExceedAction.description: Action to take on packets that exceed to the specified rate limit.

cadPolicyRateLimitExceedValue.name: cadPolicyRateLimitExceedValue
cadPolicyRateLimitExceedValue.description: Value to set if action is set-prec-transmit, set-dscp-transmit or set-priority-transmit. For set-priority-transmit,the valid value range is 0-7.

cadPolicyRateLimitClearCounts.name: cadPolicyRateLimitClearCounts
cadPolicyRateLimitClearCounts.description: If set to true, clear the counts in the CadPolicyRateLimitStatusEntry. When read, this field always returns false. The correct way to clear the counts is to first read them, then set ClearCounts to true.

cadPolicyRateLimitStatusTable.name: cadPolicyRateLimitStatusTable
cadPolicyRateLimitStatusTable.description: A table of counts of rate limiting policies applied to a physical interface.

cadPolicyRateLimitStatusEntry.name: cadPolicyRateLimitStatusEntry
cadPolicyRateLimitStatusEntry.description: Dyanmic status associated with a rate limit policy

cadPolicyRateLimitConformPackets.name: cadPolicyRateLimitConformPackets
cadPolicyRateLimitConformPackets.description: Number of packets conforming to the policy rate

cadPolicyRateLimitConformBytes.name: cadPolicyRateLimitConformBytes
cadPolicyRateLimitConformBytes.description: Number of bytes conforming to the policy rate

cadPolicyRateLimitExceedPackets.name: cadPolicyRateLimitExceedPackets
cadPolicyRateLimitExceedPackets.description: Number of packets exceeding to the policy rate

cadPolicyRateLimitExceedBytes.name: cadPolicyRateLimitExceedBytes
cadPolicyRateLimitExceedBytes.description: Number of bytes exceeding to the policy rate

cadPolicyRateLimitCurrentBurst.name: cadPolicyRateLimitCurrentBurst
cadPolicyRateLimitCurrentBurst.description: The current number of bytes in the burst exceeding the average bps rate

cadPolicyRateLimitLastCleared.name: cadPolicyRateLimitLastCleared
cadPolicyRateLimitLastCleared.description: The value of SysUptime when the rate limit counters were last cleared.

cadPolicyAclTable.name: cadPolicyAclTable
cadPolicyAclTable.description: A table contains access control list (ACL) information. Each row corresponds to an access control entry (ACE), and each ACL may have multiple ACEs that are applied in order to the packet being inspected.

cadPolicyAclEntry.name: cadPolicyAclEntry
cadPolicyAclEntry.description: A conceptual row containing information about SCM access list for each physical interface.

cadAclNumber.name: cadAclNumber
cadAclNumber.description: IPv6 ACL number. IPv6 ACLs are in the range 200-399. Extended ACL number. Extended ACLs are in the range 100-199. Standard ACLs are in the range 1-99.

cadAclIndex.name: cadAclIndex
cadAclIndex.description: Order in which this ACE is used in the ACL.

cadAclType.name: cadAclType
cadAclType.description: Indicates whether this EACE is used as a standard, extended, or remark ACL. The rate-limiting type is not valid for this table. Remark is the only valid type that can be set, standard and extended are set by the agent when the ACE is created.

cadAclStatus.name: cadAclStatus
cadAclStatus.description: RowStatus used to add and remove ACEs. ACEs that contain only remarks should have their status set to notInService and should be created with createAndWait.

cadAclPermit.name: cadAclPermit
cadAclPermit.description: Permit or Deny the packet when matched.

cadAclSrcIpMask.name: cadAclSrcIpMask
cadAclSrcIpMask.description: Source IP wildcard mask to match. Default to match anything

cadAclSrcPortLo.name: cadAclSrcPortLo
cadAclSrcPortLo.description: First Source port number to match. -1 indicates that this field is not used.

cadAclSrcPortHi.name: cadAclSrcPortHi
cadAclSrcPortHi.description: Second Source port number to match. -1 indicates that this field is not used.

cadAclDstIpMask.name: cadAclDstIpMask
cadAclDstIpMask.description: Destination IP wildcard (inverse) mask to match. Default to match anything.

cadAclDstPortLo.name: cadAclDstPortLo
cadAclDstPortLo.description: First Destination port number to match. -1 indicates that this field is not used.

cadAclDstPortHi.name: cadAclDstPortHi
cadAclDstPortHi.description: Second Destination port number to match. -1 indicates that this field is not used

cadAclLogging.name: cadAclLogging
cadAclLogging.description: Turn on or off the ACE matching log

cadAclProtoType.name: cadAclProtoType
cadAclProtoType.description: Sub-protocol qualifiers. For protocol type ICMP, this value matches the ICMP message type (0 - 255). For IGMP, this value matches the IGMP message type (0-15). A value of -1 means that this field is not used.

cadAclProtoCode.name: cadAclProtoCode
cadAclProtoCode.description: Sub-protocol qualifiers. For protocol type ICMP, this value matches the ICMP message type code (0 - 255). A value of -1 indicates this value is not used.

cadAclIpTos.name: cadAclIpTos
cadAclIpTos.description: Matches the TOS field of the IP header.

cadAclIpTosMask.name: cadAclIpTosMask
cadAclIpTosMask.description: Mask to apply to the IpTos object when finding a mactch on the TOS field of the IP header. A value of 0 is used to indicate that the TOS is not used.

cadAclTcpFlags.name: cadAclTcpFlags
cadAclTcpFlags.description: Matches the flags field of the TCP header.

cadAclTcpFlagsMask.name: cadAclTcpFlagsMask
cadAclTcpFlagsMask.description: Mask to apply to the TcpFlags object when finding a mactch on the flags field of the TCP header.

cadAclFragments.name: cadAclFragments
cadAclFragments.description: Indicates whether this EACE applies to noninitial fragments of packets. The default is disabled.

cadAclRemark.name: cadAclRemark
cadAclRemark.description: The comment associated with the access control entry. This is only valid for ACEs of type remark.

cadSnmpCommAccessTable.name: cadSnmpCommAccessTable
cadSnmpCommAccessTable.description: A table contains the access list information associated with the community string. Each community string defined in snmpCommunithTable can be configured with one access list number. C4 can permit/deny access usnig access list filtering. Filtering will occur in software, after the SNMP traffic passed through the OSE protocol stack and received by the agent. Standard ACLs will be used to enforce the access restrictions

cadSnmpCommAccessEntry.name: cadSnmpCommAccessEntry
cadSnmpCommAccessEntry.description: A conceptual row containing information about access list filtering associated with community string.

cadSnmpCommAccessName.name: cadSnmpCommAccessName
cadSnmpCommAccessName.description: The index value that uniquely identifies an entry in snmpCommunityTable.

cadSnmpCommAccessList.name: cadSnmpCommAccessList
cadSnmpCommAccessList.description: The value of this object identifies entry (or entries) in the cadPolicyAclTable. The identified entry (or entries) contains access parameters to be used when filtering traffic sent to SNMP agent.

cadSnmpCommAccessStatus.name: cadSnmpCommAccessStatus
cadSnmpCommAccessStatus.description: Control Object for row creation and deletion.

cadPolicyAccessGroupTable.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupTable
cadPolicyAccessGroupTable.description: A table of access group policies applied to a physical interface.

cadPolicyAccessGroupEntry.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupEntry
cadPolicyAccessGroupEntry.description: An ordered list of the access group polices

cadPolicyAccessGroupIfIndex.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupIfIndex
cadPolicyAccessGroupIfIndex.description: The value of this object identifies a physical layer2 interface, such as a DOCSIS MAC or a Gigabit/TenGigabit NAM, on which the access group policy is applied

cadPolicyAccessGroupDirection.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupDirection
cadPolicyAccessGroupDirection.description: Direction of traffic on interface to apply the access group policy

cadPolicyAccessGroupStatus.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupStatus
cadPolicyAccessGroupStatus.description: This table supports sets of createAndGo(4) and destroy(6)

cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv4AclNum.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv4AclNum
cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv4AclNum.description: ACL number. If the ACL does not exist, then this is treated as if the ACL type is none, i.e. all IPv4 traffic matches the policy.

cadPolicyAccessGroupClearCounts.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupClearCounts
cadPolicyAccessGroupClearCounts.description: If set to true, clear the counts in the CadPolicyAccessGroupStatusEntry. When read, this field always returns false. The correct way to clear the counts is to first read them, then set ClearCounts to true.

cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv6AclNum.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv6AclNum
cadPolicyAccessGroupIpv6AclNum.description: ACL number. If the ACL does not exist, then this is treated as if the ACL type is none, i.e. all IPv6 traffic matches the policy.

cadPolicyAccessGroupStatusTable.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupStatusTable
cadPolicyAccessGroupStatusTable.description: A table of counts of rate limiting policies applied to a physical interface.

cadPolicyAccessGroupStatusEntry.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupStatusEntry
cadPolicyAccessGroupStatusEntry.description: Dyanmic status associated with a rate limit policy

cadPolicyAccessGroupPermitPackets.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupPermitPackets
cadPolicyAccessGroupPermitPackets.description: Number of packets conforming to the access group policy permit ACL

cadPolicyAccessGroupDenyPackets.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupDenyPackets
cadPolicyAccessGroupDenyPackets.description: Number of packets conforming to the access group policy deny ACL

cadPolicyAccessGroupLastCleared.name: cadPolicyAccessGroupLastCleared
cadPolicyAccessGroupLastCleared.description: The value of SysUptime when the access group policy counters were last cleared.

cadPolicyPfxListEntry.name: cadPolicyPfxListEntry
cadPolicyPfxListEntry.description: A row in Prefix list table

cadPolicyPfxListNumber.name: cadPolicyPfxListNumber
cadPolicyPfxListNumber.description: Prefix list is identified by number value of 0 should be passed for this object if prefix list is configured by name

cadPolicyPfxListName.name: cadPolicyPfxListName
cadPolicyPfxListName.description: Name of prefix list.Null value is assigned to this Object if the prefix list is identified by number

cadPolicyPfxListSeqNumber.name: cadPolicyPfxListSeqNumber
cadPolicyPfxListSeqNumber.description: A sequence in the prefix list is identified by sequence number. If no sequence is specified defalut sequence of 5 is assumend. IF one more sequence is configured sequence number 10 is assigned (multiples of 5)

cadPolicyPfxListIpAddress.name: cadPolicyPfxListIpAddress
cadPolicyPfxListIpAddress.description: This is the source ipv4 or ipv6 address on which the filtering needs to be applied

cadPolicyPfxListIpAddMaskLen.name: cadPolicyPfxListIpAddMaskLen
cadPolicyPfxListIpAddMaskLen.description: Mask length of the Source IP address

cadPolicyPfxListMaskGeValue.name: cadPolicyPfxListMaskGeValue
cadPolicyPfxListMaskGeValue.description: If the received route matches the source address and the mask length is greater than the value specified, apply the specified action to the route

cadPolicyPfxListMaskLeValue.name: cadPolicyPfxListMaskLeValue
cadPolicyPfxListMaskLeValue.description: This value specifies if the received route mask length is less the value specified here do the action specified (permit/deny)

cadPolicyPfxListAction.name: cadPolicyPfxListAction
cadPolicyPfxListAction.description: specifies the action to be taken. Possible actions include permit(1) and deny(2)

cadPolicyPfxListStatus.name: cadPolicyPfxListStatus
cadPolicyPfxListStatus.description: The row status variable, used according to row installation and removal conventions.

cadPolicyPfxListAfi.name: cadPolicyPfxListAfi
cadPolicyPfxListAfi.description: This is the Address Family Identifier (AFI) of the prefix that will follow. Only IPv4 or IPv6 prefix-list will be supported.

cadPolicyPfxListSafi.name: cadPolicyPfxListSafi
cadPolicyPfxListSafi.description: This is the Subsequent Address Family Identifier (SAFI) of the prefix that will follow.

cadPolicyDistListOutEntry.name: cadPolicyDistListOutEntry
cadPolicyDistListOutEntry.description: A row in Distribute List Out table

cadPolicyDistListOutSrcProtocol.name: cadPolicyDistListOutSrcProtocol
cadPolicyDistListOutSrcProtocol.description: Source Protocol under which distribute list is configured.

cadPolicyDistListOutSrcProtocolProcess.name: cadPolicyDistListOutSrcProtocolProcess
cadPolicyDistListOutSrcProtocolProcess.description: Source VRF ID under which distribute list is configured.

cadPolicyDistListOutRoutingProtocol.name: cadPolicyDistListOutRoutingProtocol
cadPolicyDistListOutRoutingProtocol.description: Destination Protocol to which routes need to be sent.

cadPolicyDistListOutRoutingProcess.name: cadPolicyDistListOutRoutingProcess
cadPolicyDistListOutRoutingProcess.description: Destination VRF ID under which distribute list is configured.

cadPolicyDistListOutAutonomousSystemNum.name: cadPolicyDistListOutAutonomousSystemNum
cadPolicyDistListOutAutonomousSystemNum.description: Autonomous system number of BGP to which routes need to be redistributed. If destination protocol is BGP appropriate AS number needs to be filled for this object. Otherwise set a value of 1 for this object.

cadPolicyDistListOutAccessListNum.name: cadPolicyDistListOutAccessListNum
cadPolicyDistListOutAccessListNum.description: The configured distribute out list refers to the access list specified. The access list number must be in the range of 1 - 99

cadPolicyDistListOutAccessListName.name: cadPolicyDistListOutAccessListName
cadPolicyDistListOutAccessListName.description: Name of the access list referred by distribute list. The access list name must be less than 32 characters

cadPolicyDistListOutStatus.name: cadPolicyDistListOutStatus
cadPolicyDistListOutStatus.description: The row status variable, used according to row installation and removal conventions. Once access list specified default row status is UP.

cadPolicyDistListOutIfIndex.name: cadPolicyDistListOutIfIndex
cadPolicyDistListOutIfIndex.description: Interface for which distribute list is applied. The value will be 1 if the distribute list is applied to all interfaces.

cadDistListOutEntry.name: cadDistListOutEntry
cadDistListOutEntry.description: A row in Distribute List Out table

cadDistListOutDestProtocol.name: cadDistListOutDestProtocol
cadDistListOutDestProtocol.description: Destination protocol for which distribute list is applied.

cadDistListOutSrcProtocol.name: cadDistListOutSrcProtocol
cadDistListOutSrcProtocol.description: Source protocol for which distribute list is applied.

cadDistListOutStatus.name: cadDistListOutStatus
cadDistListOutStatus.description: The row status variable, used according to row installation and removal conventions. Once access list specified default row status is active.

cadAclNameTable.name: cadAclNameTable
cadAclNameTable.description: This table maps names to ACL entries. Each row associates a name with the indexed ACL.

cadAclNameEntry.name: cadAclNameEntry
cadAclNameEntry.description: A conceptual row containing name information about an ACL.

cadNameAclName.name: cadNameAclName
cadNameAclName.description: The name of the access control list.

cadNameAclNumber.name: cadNameAclNumber
cadNameAclNumber.description: Extended ACL number. Extended ACLs are in the range 100-199. Standard ACLs are in the range 1-99.

cadNameAclStatus.name: cadNameAclStatus
cadNameAclStatus.description: RowStatus used to add and remove names for ACLs. When an ACL is removed, the associated name is also removed.

cadAclOrderAcl.name: cadAclOrderAcl
cadAclOrderAcl.description: This variable always returns false(2) upon reading. When set to true(1), the ACL identified in cadAclOrderAclIndex is renumbered with interval cadAclOrderAclInterval.

cadAclOrderAclIndex.name: cadAclOrderAclIndex
cadAclOrderAclIndex.description: This variable identifies the ACL that should be renumbered.

cadAclOrderAclInterval.name: cadAclOrderAclInterval
cadAclOrderAclInterval.description: This variable specifies the numbering interval used between each ACE when reordering an ACL.

cadAclOrderAclStart.name: cadAclOrderAclStart
cadAclOrderAclStart.description: This variable specifies the index that ACL reordering will use as the base for the first ACE.

cadAclClearIpv4AclCounts.name: cadAclClearIpv4AclCounts
cadAclClearIpv4AclCounts.description: This variable specifies the access list number for which all IPv4 per-entry counts will be cleared. This number may correspond to an individual access list (1..199). Setting to '0' will cause the per-entry counts to be cleared for ALL IPv4 configured access lists. This variable always returns '0' upon reading

cadAclClearIpv6AclCounts.name: cadAclClearIpv6AclCounts
cadAclClearIpv6AclCounts.description: This variable specifies the access list number for which all IPv6 per-entry counts will be cleared. This number may correspond to an individual access list (200..399). Setting to '0' will cause the per-entry counts to be cleared for ALL IPv6 configured access lists. This variable always returns '0' upon reading

cadPolicyAclExtTable.name: cadPolicyAclExtTable
cadPolicyAclExtTable.description: The cadPolicyAclExtTable augments the cadPolicyAclTable with a count for total number of times the access list entry has been matched by all referencing applications.

cadPolicyAclExtEntry.name: cadPolicyAclExtEntry
cadPolicyAclExtEntry.description: Information about the policy access list entry.

cadAclEntryCount.name: cadAclEntryCount
cadAclEntryCount.description: Total number of times the access list entry has been matched by all referencing applications.

cadRouteMapTagTable.name: cadRouteMapTagTable
cadRouteMapTagTable.description: This table maps policy route map names to route map entries. Each row associates a name with the indexed policy route map.

cadRouteMapTagEntry.name: cadRouteMapTagEntry
cadRouteMapTagEntry.description: A conceptual row containing name information for a policy route map.

cadRouteMapTagName.name: cadRouteMapTagName
cadRouteMapTagName.description: Name to used for this policy route map

cadRouteMapTagId.name: cadRouteMapTagId
cadRouteMapTagId.description: Id used to associate entries in the policy route map table to this name.

cadRouteMapTagRowStatus.name: cadRouteMapTagRowStatus
cadRouteMapTagRowStatus.description: The row status variable used according to row installation and removal convention. In our case, we have simplified this to the usage of only the following states - active, createAndGo, and destroy. Other three states notInService, notReady and createAndWait are not permitted.

cadRouteMapTable.name: cadRouteMapTable
cadRouteMapTable.description: This table contains policy route map data where each row contains information about the ACL being used and what set operations should be applied to the IP packet on a match.

cadRouteMapEntry.name: cadRouteMapEntry
cadRouteMapEntry.description: A conceptual row containing information for a policy route map entry.

cadRouteMapId.name: cadRouteMapId
cadRouteMapId.description: Id used to associate entries in the policy route map table.

cadRouteMapSeqNum.name: cadRouteMapSeqNum
cadRouteMapSeqNum.description: Sequence number used to order the match statements.

cadRouteMapMatchType.name: cadRouteMapMatchType
cadRouteMapMatchType.description: Type of match to used for this entry. Permit matches on the provided ACL and then applies the defined set operations before destination routing. Deny matches on the provided ACL and then directly routes to the destination without applying any of the set critera to the packet.

cadRouteMapMatchAcl.name: cadRouteMapMatchAcl
cadRouteMapMatchAcl.description: ACL used to match the incoming packet. Since IPv4 is the only supported address type, the ACL number must be an extended or standard ACL. A value 0 implies that no ACL is used and all packets will match this entry.

cadRouteMapSetIpPrec.name: cadRouteMapSetIpPrec
cadRouteMapSetIpPrec.description: Indicates whether the IP Precedence should be changed on the packet if it matches the ACL and this is a permit type of match.

cadRouteMapIpPrec.name: cadRouteMapIpPrec
cadRouteMapIpPrec.description: The IP precedence value that should be used to replace the existing IP precedence of the matching packet.

cadRouteMapSetIpTos.name: cadRouteMapSetIpTos
cadRouteMapSetIpTos.description: Indicates whether the IP TOS should be changed on the packet if it matches the ACL and this is a permit type of match.

cadRouteMapIpTos.name: cadRouteMapIpTos
cadRouteMapIpTos.description: The IP TOS value that should be used to replace the existing IP TOS of the matching packet.

cadRouteMapSetNextHop.name: cadRouteMapSetNextHop
cadRouteMapSetNextHop.description: Indicates whether the next hop setting should be used to specify the adjacent next hop router when forwarding the matching packet.

cadRouteMapNextHopAddrType.name: cadRouteMapNextHopAddrType
cadRouteMapNextHopAddrType.description: The address type of the next hop and backup next hop addresses. Currently IPv4 is the only supported address type.

cadRouteMapNextHop.name: cadRouteMapNextHop
cadRouteMapNextHop.description: The address of the adjacent next hop router to use in forwading the matching packet. The next hop router address must be the address of an ajacent router, and the routing table (VRF?) is used to verify that the address can be directly reached. Only IPv4 addresses are currently supported.

cadRouteMapSetBackupNextHop.name: cadRouteMapSetBackupNextHop
cadRouteMapSetBackupNextHop.description: Indicates whether the backup next hop setting should be used to specify the adjacent next hop router when forwarding the matching packet. This only would be done if the primary next hop was not set or was unreachable.

cadRouteMapBackupNextHop.name: cadRouteMapBackupNextHop
cadRouteMapBackupNextHop.description: The address type of a second next hop, that can be used only if the primary next hop address can not be reached. Only Ipv4 addresses are currently supported.

cadRouteMapSetNullInterface.name: cadRouteMapSetNullInterface
cadRouteMapSetNullInterface.description: If set to true and the packet matches the ACL, it will be dropped.

cadRouteMapRowStatus.name: cadRouteMapRowStatus
cadRouteMapRowStatus.description: The row status variable used according to row installation and removal convention. In our case, we have simplified this to the usage of only the following states - active, createAndGo, and destroy. Other three states notInService, notReady and createAndWait are not permitted.

cadRouteMapSetIpDscp.name: cadRouteMapSetIpDscp
cadRouteMapSetIpDscp.description: Indicates whether the IP DSCP should be changed on the packet if it matches the ACL and this is a permit type of match.

cadRouteMapIpDscp.name: cadRouteMapIpDscp
cadRouteMapIpDscp.description: The IP DSCP value that should be used to replace the existing IP DSCP of the matching packet.

cadRouteMapSetRecursiveNextHop.name: cadRouteMapSetRecursiveNextHop
cadRouteMapSetRecursiveNextHop.description: Indicates whether the recursive next hop setting should be used to specify the next hop for the remote router when forwarding the matching packet.

cadRouteMapRecursiveNextHop.name: cadRouteMapRecursiveNextHop
cadRouteMapRecursiveNextHop.description: The address type of a remote router next hop, that is used to perform a recursive route lookup. Only Ipv4 addresses are currently supported.

cadRouteMapStatsTable.name: cadRouteMapStatsTable
cadRouteMapStatsTable.description: This table contains policy route map counts where each row contains information about the number of packets that match the specified ACL and were successfully changed with the defined set operations, as well as those that matched the ACL but failed the set operations.

cadRouteMapStatsEntry.name: cadRouteMapStatsEntry
cadRouteMapStatsEntry.description: A conceptual row containing counts information for a policy route map entry.

cadRouteMapPktMatched.name: cadRouteMapPktMatched
cadRouteMapPktMatched.description: The number of packets that match the ACL defined in the route map entry and where the action was also successful. For matches of type deny, the packet is routed by destination, and for packets of type match, the packet is successfully modified and sent.

cadRouteMapByteMatched.name: cadRouteMapByteMatched
cadRouteMapByteMatched.description: The number of bytes that match the ACL defined in the route map entry and where the action was also successful. For matches of type deny, the packet is routed by destination, and for packets of type match, the packet is successfully modified and sent.

cadRouteMapPktFailed.name: cadRouteMapPktFailed
cadRouteMapPktFailed.description: The number of packets that match the ACL defined in the route map entry and where the action failed. For route map entries of type match, the set operation failed.

cadRouteMapByteFailed.name: cadRouteMapByteFailed
cadRouteMapByteFailed.description: The number of packets that match the ACL defined in the route map entry and where the action failed. For route map entries of type match, the set operation failed.

cadRouteMapClearStats.name: cadRouteMapClearStats
cadRouteMapClearStats.description: Setting this value will reset all the byte and packet counts for a route map. A value of 0 indicates no reset is performed.

cadLocalPolicyRouteMap.name: cadLocalPolicyRouteMap
cadLocalPolicyRouteMap.description: This value contains the mapId of the policy route map to be used for local policy based routing. A value of 0 indicates no local policy routing is performed.
